hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin Volatility Compression Preceding BEAR Regime Breakdown
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 10-day realized volatility ratio (Avg Top 10 Altcoins / BTC) falls below 0.5 during a NEUTRAL regime, a breakdown below key BTC support levels will trigger a transition to a BEAR regime with >60% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Severe altcoin volatility compression relative to BTC indicates drying liquidity and risk aversion beneath the surface. This 'calm before the storm' often resolves downward when BTC finally breaks support, as weak altcoin markets offer no cushion.
entry_conditions: 10-day realized volatility (avg of AVAX, SOL, DOGE, PEPE, etc.) / BTC 10-day realized volatility < 0.5 for 3 consecutive days
BTC price breaks below its 20-day low on a closing basis
Trade: Reduce altcoin exposure, initiate BTC short or long put options

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC reclaims above its 20-day low AND altcoin/BTC vol ratio rises above 0.7
exit_conditions.time_exit: 7 trading days after BTC breakdown if no regime shift

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of such signals see BTC break down but then recover without a BEAR regime shift (i.e., a false breakdown).
